sentences: Robert Berg (April 7, 1951 – December 5, 2002) was an American jazz saxophonist.
Berg was born in Brooklyn, New York, United States.
Berg was influenced by the late 1964–67 period of John Coltrane's music.
A student from the hard bop school, Berg played from 1973 to 1976 with Horace Silver and, from 1977 to 1983, with Cedar Walton.
Berg became more widely known when he joined Miles Davis band in 1984.
After leaving Davis's band in 1987, Berg released a series of solo albums and also performed and recorded frequently in a group co-led with guitarist Mike Stern.
He worked with Chick Corea, Steve Gadd and Eddie Gómez in a quartet.
Berg was killed in a traffic accident in East Hampton, New York, while driving near his home with Arja, his wife.
